alert.note: Alert for Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 5:17AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following county, Albany. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Westerlo, Berne, Voorheesville, Altamont, New Scotland, Knox, Rensselaerville, Clarksville, Reidsville, Bramans Corners, Wolf Hill, Helderberg, East Berne, Thompsons Lake, Snyders Corners, Thatcher State Park, Bensons Corners, New Salem, South Berne and Dormansville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
